message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the purchase of my product with you. I believe it's a game-changer and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to offer it to you for $950000. This is a competitive price considering its worth to you is $800000. I'm looking forward to hearing your thoughts.

I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, Alice, but I'm a bit concerned about the price. I'm willing to pay $850000 for the product. I believe it's a fair price considering its worth to me, and I think it's a good starting point for further discussion.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand your concerns about the price, but I'm still confident that my product is worth more than $850000 to you. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $900000. This is a fair price considering its value to you and the benefits it will bring to your business.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but I'm still a bit short of my budget. I'm willing to pay $875000 for the product. I think this is a reasonable price, considering the value it will bring to my business and the fact that I can buy it from John for $800000 if I don't come to an agreement with you.

I understand your concerns, Bob, and I appreciate your honesty about your budget. However, I'm still not willing to go below $925000. This is the minimum price I'm willing to accept, considering the product's value and the benefits it will bring to your business. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I need to prioritize my own interests as well.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway again, but $925000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $885000 for the product. I think this is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement at this price. If not, I'll have to consider buying from John for $800000.
